intro: Ardisia opegrapha, commonly known as the white-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Ardisia opegrapha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting flowers.
